intro: Linkia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf linkia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
